result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Sowinski

defendant.name: Sowinski, John
defendant.address: 10340 South Nicholson Road, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Sowinski appeared by video.  Attorney Kirk D Henley appeared by video for John Sowinski.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel informed the Court that this case may be a Veteran's Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Defendant to get a TAD evaluation scheduled.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John Sowinski appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court. Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Kirk Henley to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month. Repayment to begin NOVEMBER 1ST, 2022.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  DF,ML and The Cellar.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant John Sowinski in court.    Madeline Witte, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/15/2022@1:30pm
